de.susebox.jtopas
Interface KeywordHandler

All Superinterfaces:
Plugin
Deprecated. Replaced by KeywordHandler (de.susebox.jtopas.spi.KeywordHandler)

public interface KeywordHandler
extends Plugin

This interface must be implemented by classes that should be used as a keyword handler plugin in the PluginTokenizer.

This interface is deprecated. Use the new KeywordHandler interface in the SPI package instead.

Author:
Heiko Blau
See Also:
Tokenizer, AbstractTokenizer

Method Summary
 TokenizerProperty isKeyword(int startingAtPos, int length)
          Deprecated. This method checks if the character sequence starting at a given position with a given length is a keyword.
 
Methods inherited from interface de.susebox.jtopas.Plugin
setTokenizer
 

Method Detail

isKeyword

public TokenizerProperty isKeyword(int startingAtPos,
                                   int length)
Deprecated. 
This method checks if the character sequence starting at a given position with a given length is a keyword. If so, it returns the keyword description as TokenizerProperty object. If the method needs to build a string from the character sequence it may use Tokenizer.getText(int, int) or AbstractTokenizer.getTextUnchecked(int, int) to retrieve it.

Parameters:
startingAtPos - check at this position
length - number of characters in the token to be tested
Returns:
TokenizerProperty describing the keyword or null
